TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PanelContainerDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control is used as a container for other controls, especially when controls are generated programmatically.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control is parsed, and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> controls in a visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property gets the caption that appears on the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property gets the styles of the associated control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method sets collection elements to the string representations of various style attributes of the associated control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class to change the appearance and behavior of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyPanelContainer` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control. The example also derives the `MyPanelContainerDesigner` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class and applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyPanelContainerDesigner` on the `MyPanelContainer` class.
The `MyPanelContainerDesigner` overrides the following <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> members:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property to define a design-time border style for the `MyPanelContainer` control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property to provide a default caption for the `MyPanelContainer` control, if none was defined.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception, if the associated control is not a `MyPanelContainer` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/CS/PanelContainerDesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/VB/PanelContainerDesigner.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control or a copy of that control on the visual designer surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddDesignTimeCssAttributes(class System.Collections.IDictionary styleAttributes) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of style attributes implementing the .
Docs.summary: Adds string representations of style attributes to a collection to be used in the design-time rendering of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> base method, which adds string representations of style attributes to the `styleAttributes` collection. These attributes are based on the style properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> sets the direction of `styleAttribute` to a code indicating left-to-right or right-to-left, based on the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel.Direction%2A> property of the associated control.

Docs.summary: Gets the caption that appears on the associated control.
Docs.value: A string that contains the panel caption.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel.GroupingText%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> class at design time. The example provides a default caption for the associated control, if none was defined.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/CS/PanelContainerDesigner.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/VB/PanelContainerDesigner.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets the styles of the associated control.
Docs.value: A object that contains the design-time styles for the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property is an empty string (""), the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property returns an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object. Otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property returns a default <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that is generated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> base property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> class at design time. The example defines a design-time border style for the associated control.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/CS/PanelContainerDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/VB/PanelContainerDesigner.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class to change the behavior of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> class at design time. The example throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception, if the associated control is not a `MyPanelContainer` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/CS/PanelContainerDesigner.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner/VB/PanelContainerDesigner.vb#5)]

Docs.exception: is not a or of a class derived from .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the control is marked with a class-level attribute. If the is not overridden, the control ignores the attribute.
